intro: Isolepis langsdorffiana, commonly known as the narrowleaf spike-rush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its slender, cylindrical stems are often clustered and bear small, scale-like leaves. Isolepis langsdorffiana produces spikes of tiny, wind-pollinated flowers, which are usually green or brown in color.
